gw.processes

Class WorkQueueBase<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueue<E,W>
      • gw.processes.WorkQueueBase<E,W>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.DistributedWorker<W>, com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkItemCreator<E,W>, com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueueTargetFinder<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BulkInsertWorkQueueBase

    public abstract class WorkQueueBase<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem>
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueue<E,W>
implements com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueueTargetFinder<E>, com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.DistributedWorker<W>, com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkItemCreator<E,W>
    This class in the base class for all customer work queues. This object will be instantiated once on each server that is processing the configured WorkQueue. A subclass must implement processWorkItem. This will be called whenever a WorkItem for this queue is to be processed. It maybe called on any server that this WorkQueue has been configured for. It is run within a transaction. Until a subclass implements findWorkItems, the batch process will do no work. If W is not StandardWorkItem, you must also implement createWorkItem before the batch process will work successfully.

    Example: 
    
 package gw.test
 uses gw.processes.WorkQueueBase
 class TestWorkQueue1 extends WorkQueueBase<TestGraphRoot, StandardWorkItem> {
   static function newWorkItem(bean : TestGraphRoot, bundle : Bundle) : StandardWorkItem {
     return newStandardWorkItem(bean, "TestGosuWorkQueue", bundle)
   }
   construct() {
     super("TestGosuWorkQueue", StandardWorkItem, TestGraphRoot)
   }
   override function processWorkItem(workItem : StandardWorkItem) {
     Transaction.runWithNewBundle(\ bundle -> {
       workItem = bundle.add(workItem)
       var target = extractTarget(workItem)
       ...
     }, "su")
   }
   override function createWorkItem(bean : TestGraphRoot, bundle : Bundle) : StandardWorkItem {
     return newWorkItem(bean, bundle)
   }
   override function findTargets() : Iterator<TestGraphRoot> {
     return find(tgr in TestGraphRoot)
   }
 }

      • modifyFindWorkItemQuery

        protected void modifyFindWorkItemQuery(Query<W> query,
                                       java.util.Date dbNow)
        This will permit the query to be refined. If you want to restrict a workqueue to only one of the target entity being processed by any other worker you could modify the query like. 
        
 var checkedOutQ = Query.make(StandardWorkItem)
 checkedOutQ.compare("status", Equals, WorkItemStatusType.TC_CHECKEDOUT)
 query.subselect("target", CompareNotIn, checkedOutQ, "target")
        Overrides:
        modifyFindWorkItemQuery in class com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueue<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem>
        Parameters:
        query - the query to modify
        dbNow - the current date

      • processWorkItem

        public abstract void processWorkItem(W item)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This will process this work item. This is inside of its own transaction. IMPLEMENTATION NOTE: If an exception is thrown from this method, it will be retried. Immediately if CDCE. This is profiled with tag "WorkerProcessWorkItem" This is logged with logger WorkQueue.Item You may want to lock the target
        Specified by:
        processWorkItem in interface com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.DistributedWorker<W extends WorkItem>
        Parameters:
        item - the WorkItem to process
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • logStackTraceForWorkItem

        public void logStackTraceForWorkItem(W workItem,
                                     java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        This method will be ced on each execution if there is an exception processing the work item. It will be ced up to max retry times. This is a user exit so they may perform notification actions in the case.
        Specified by:
        logStackTraceForWorkItem in interface com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.DistributedWorker<W extends WorkItem>
        Parameters:
        workItem - the WorkItem that cause an exception
        throwable - the exception that was caught

      • workItemFailed

        public void workItemFailed(W workItem)
        This method is ced when the work item is being flagged as failed. It will occur after the number of retries has been exceeded and the next selection found that it has exceeded the max retry times. (i.e., processtime * (maxretries + 1))
        Specified by:
        workItemFailed in interface com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.DistributedWorker<W extends WorkItem>
        Parameters:
        workItem - the WorkItem that has been already processed maxRetry times

      • findTargets

        public java.util.Iterator<E> findTargets()
        This will return the items to be added to the work queue. IMPLEMENTATION NOTE: This needs to be implemented if you want to populate the work queue via it's batch process. This could be a simple query result if the determination is too complex, as the shouldProcessItem method can be used to fine tune these results. Once this has been defined you can add categories to the BatchProcessType to indicate that it is UIRunnable and/or Schedulable
        Specified by:
        findTargets in interface com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueueTargetFinder<E extends KeyableBean>
        Returns:
        an iterator over target items.

      • shouldProcessItem

        public boolean shouldProcessItem(E target)

        Parameters:
        target - the bean to be checked
        Returns:
        true if this bean is to be processed

      • createWorkItem

        public W createWorkItem(E target,
                        Bundle safeBundle)
        This method will create a new work item. IMPLEMENTATION NOTE: The default implementation uses StandardWorkItem to contain the information. It only needs to be overridden if you want to use some other entity that is a delegate of WorkItem for your work item.
        Parameters:
        target - the target object
        safeBundle - the bundle
        Returns:
        a new work item
